Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional, unorganized, and not all cleanly!”
Reviews.Author: Kat082906
Reviews.Content: We came in for a dance comp we were supposed to be a able to sign in at 3pm, the problem was that the rooms were not clean for many staying. So they had to be put on another floor. Aside from not being ready for us to check in, the room that we were given was dirty! There was a mark on the sink where the tissue box sat. It was disgusting, there was also a spot on the wall by the window opens where the wallpaper was torn back about a foot and half with mold growing where the window had leaked when it rained. We never would have known due to the window covering does not allow to see it if ur not looking for it. We found it by accident. There were also hairs on the toilet and shower stall. The rooms were spacious minus the bathroom, if u have a person that is not a toothpick, then closing the bathroom door will be pretty difficult. I was only refunded half the coSt of the stay and I would have to say that I will not be going back again. And the breakfast is OK the next morning but the servers are somewhat clumsy. They should not be working in a small enclosed space. Do not waste ur money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great campus location”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to spend the night here on 3/12 and found the rooms very relaxing and great size with all the amenities of a studio apartment. Breakfast was made to order omletes along with all the staples you would find at a continental breakfast plus more. My room was quite a distance from the lobby as the hotel is spread out in wings, but the pool/sauna and exercise room is more than adequate. Parking is a chalenge as the hotel only has about 15 spots in front of the hotel and they have a lot across the street you use, that is closer to the confer4ence center portion of the hotel. It is a bit challenging but not all that bad. The staff was so outgoing and eager to help, you always felt like a friend. Definetly would stay again. The only problem, and it was not a bad one, was there were a number of lady bugs outside our window and few crept in, but that also happens to me at home also.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities but parking is scattered and weird.”
Reviews.Author: traybird
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for three nights at the beginning of March. We have a toddler and this place was great for us. The breakfast every morning makes hotel life with a family easy. We stayed on the first floor pretty close to the lobby amd it was really quiet. I only heard one loud outburst whole I was sleeping. We used the pool and hot tub and the pool could have been a little warmer. The breakfast was decent each morning with one exception...the waffles. There should be a little sign that says the iron needs to be sprayed before you use it. Also, the waffle batter tasted pretty bad. It's not sweet enough and needs cinnamon and nutmeg added. There's a guy who will make you an omlet to order which is great. Our room was great except for the tiny bathroom. The beds are super comfy with exception of the pillows. We had a king bed and the king pillows tend to be filled too much and these pillows were also lumpy. They should use three standard pillows instead. We enjoyed our stay otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, not the best.”
Reviews.Author: Jmmaurer219
Reviews.Content: Would be a solid four star hotel if not for a few negatives. Positives: central location, spacious rooms. Negatives: parking is HORRIBLE, staff seems to not care much about customer service. Even heard desk girl complaining to coworker about another guest. Workout equipment broken.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: Gary K
Reviews.Content: We hold a family get-together in Champaign over the Christmas holiday.This year our pooch was not feeling so well and she needed attention that she wouldn't get at the kennel. Hawthorn takes pets so it solved our problem. They were good hosts. Friendly staff, clean rooms and a great rate. We'll consider this again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: KJW2011
Reviews.Content: My rating would actually be above the average I gave it except I admit to being a bit picky when it comes to hotels. This one was actually quite nice, decent breakfast, had a king suite with decent room size and the desk staff were very pleasant. Only negative was the parking - there wasn't any right by the hotel, very few spots so you may have to park a ways away. This was just a one-nighter on the way to Rockford but would recommend if you got it for a good price. The area around was safe and I felt comfortable here.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay! Nice room! Great breakfast! Careful of the TV remote!”
Reviews.Author: Monstertamer
Reviews.Content: Had a GREAT stay! We had a wedding in town. Made the mistake of picking up the remote for the TV. And got a 16.99 charge for a movie I didn't watch or even knew i watched. Just looking at the menu is what i found out at the front desk. She told me i should have asked for the movie's to be blocked when i checked in. We dont Stay out that offen so didn't know. Need to call the desk manger to get this cleared up. Other then that it was a great stay! Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good (though very generic) hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve8489
Reviews.Content: We were here for three days while my spouse attended a conference nearby. I wasn't registered for the conference, so I spent a LOT of time at the hotel. It's basically a very generic, nondescript corporate/conference hotel. You'll see lots of middle-manager types hanging out in the lobby and breakfast area. Very bland decor and somewhat light on amenities, probably because they assume that the typical guest isn't going to spend a lot of time relaxing on the property. The rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable. We had a nice, big HD television, and fortunately there were some HD channels available (I'm amazed at how many hotels have installed HD sets in every room but still have only SD channels). Internet is free, and is wired (which is okay with me because it's generally faster than wifi). The free breakfast is very elaborate and includes waffle and omelet stations. The pool area is very small, but clean and quiet (I had it to myself most of the time). The hotel doesn't have a bar or restaurant, but there are plenty of options within easy walking distance. On the minus side: The "fitness center" is only slightly larger than a walk-in closet. The staff seems bored and indifferent; you will NOT get a welcoming smile when you approach the check-in desk. Parking is limited, and unless you're lucky, you'll probably have to park in the lot across the street. Oh, and the hotel is evidently popular with visiting youth sports teams; if you're there on the weekend you may encounter LOTS of kids. (One afternoon I saw a family checking in, and a hotel staffer sternly gave them a sheet of paper with the hotel's "sports rules.")

Reviews.Title: “Nice! Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Seniorcitizen72
Reviews.Content: We liked it! Large clean room. Comfortable bed. Two restaurants within easy walking distance. Delicious omelet for breakfast. Limited but convenient parking.

Reviews.Title: “Mid level property, so-so stay and condition”
Reviews.Author: nwh7928
Reviews.Content: We were here for one night for a family function. The hotel is an average property, in slightly below average condition. Our second floor room was musty, and showed a fair amount of wear and tear. I was bothered by the lack of cleanliness. Both in the common areas and our room, everything needed a good deep cleaning, or better yet a renovation. I am mystified by the other reviewers who thought the hotel was awesome with no problems...I think we all just have different standards to which we hold properties. The bed was okay, at best. The air conditioning unit was loud, and probably in need of cleaning as the air coming out of the unit smelled badly. The bathroom was slightly dirty (hairs hanging down from the ceiling over the shower...not sure how this even happened!), and again everything else was just low quality and in need of deep cleaning. Check in/checkout was okay...not professional, but nothing else was at the hotel anyway. Parking was difficult, as there are only a few spots in front of the hotel, and all other parking is a bit of a walk across/slightly down the street. I would not stay here again before a refreshing occurs at this property. If your expectations are just a bed for a night and you are not terribly picky about luxury or comfort, you'll probably be okay. But, with newer properties nearby, I just don't see a reason to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: windycity_773
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, not sure why anyone would complain other than it's busy. Very nice rooms, with extremely comfortable beds. The breakfast is terriffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Moms weekend”
Reviews.Author: chigal
Reviews.Content: I dont know what all the other reviewers were complaining about. I loved this hotel. It was clean and the staff was great. Called cabs for us when we needed them. We could of walked to my sons fraternity but chose the cheap cab ride. Great breakfast also. Didnt check out the pool due to my son had the weekend packed with activities so didnt have the time. Im booked for next year.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel stay in years”
Reviews.Author: rmpa45
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed the Saturday after Thanksgiving. We had booked at this particular hotel due to the website layout of the room we chose. We wanted to have one area for the children to sleep in while my husband and I would be able to stay up and read, watch TV, etc in the adjoining sitting area. When we checked in, the room was not like that at all, nor were any of the rooms in the hotel according to the front desk. So we'd paid a lot of extra money (to us, $40 extra is a big deal) for no added value. Also, the cable was out, so we were stuck in a hotel room with the children with nothing to do. Hubby took the kids to the pool while I unpacked, hot tub broken. Plug in the bathtub broken so the kids got a shower before bed instead of a bath which is a pain with little kids. After all of this, the hotel staff did agree to decrease our fee by $30, which took a little of the sting out. The worst part of the night, though, was yet to come. At about 11 pm, there were several groups of teenagers in the area outside of our room which I chased off a couple of times. Unfortunately they kept coming back. This kept my husband and I as well as our younger child awake until midnight. I finally called the front desk after speaking to the teen group chaperone seemed to do little good. I think they must have sent someone up; either that or the kids finally went to sleep. Our drive home stunk as we were worn out because of our miserable night. Unfortunate all around, as the mattresses and pillows were comfortable for a hotel so we probably would have slept well otherwise. The room not as advertised, several things out of order, and significant issues with other guests really ruined this for us. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “A busy hotel with nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: RamblingRed
Reviews.Content: This place was hopping from the afternoon I arrived to the morning I left, but it was a pretty pleasant stay. The room I stayed in was large and smelled clean, with a couch and kitchen area. What I loved was how soft the linens were! Wow, it kind of made my day. I wasn't too thrilled with the door connecting with another one (those two-sided lock things) and I could hear the entire cell phone conversation of my neighbor. I was also a bit too close to the breakfast area and heard constant clanking plates. However, I wasn't bothered by any other noise, and none of this affected me getting a good night's sleep. For food, the free breakfast was nicely presented, and TGIFridays is right next door. A couple of the people working at the hotel seemed absolutely shocked that I would consider walking to the nearby University of Illinois, but it took less than 10 minutes to be strolling through the west side of campus.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JP1975
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great if you are going to a game on campus. Rooms were decent, shower drain was a little nasty. Overall was ok though. Plenty of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ky_tax_man
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hawthorn Suites hotel in Champaign IL due to the fact that I was attending a conference at a nearby hotel. This was the second time that I have stayed at this hotel. The main reason that I came back was because of the fantastic deal that I got on the room. Furthermore, the Hawthorn was within walking distance of the hotel where my conference was being held as well as a number or restaurants. The room was comfortable and had all the amenities that I required as a business traveler. The only thing that I didn't enjoy was having a room on the first floor and near the Hawthorn's conference center. I could hear peopling walking from the conference center to the lobby during the evening and into the night. Additionally, the air conditioner was very loud and woke me a number of times when it kicked on. Overall, the Hawthorn Suites is a good hotel that offers a great bang for your buck if you need to stay in the Champaign / Urbana area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Content: Visiting Champaign on a recent business trip I stayed at this property and had a nice stay. The location of the hotel is very close to the University of Illinois. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and very spacious. The morning breakfast buffett is excellent and the access to a shuttle to and from the airport was very timely. I would recommend this hotel and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Sistersmatter
Reviews.Content: The suite we stayed in was very bright, fresh, comfortable, clean. Great bed. Great service. Very extensive continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful !!”
Reviews.Author: anyaMunster
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life. To start our five night stay, we were directed to a room at the far end of the hotel. After checking in late we went to sleep and decided to shower in the morning. Upon exiting the shower, I noticed what appeared to be chocolate pudding on the wall behind the bathroom door; however, I am pretty sure it wasn't chocolate pudding if you get my drift. I immediately contacted the front desk and demanded a room change. I should have demanded a refund and left. We changed rooms and were immediately surprised that our new room was smaller (much smaller) than our old room. The room was so small, that you had to practically stand in the bathtub to close the door in order to use the facilities. If this wasn't enough management decided to book what appeared to be traveling fraternity brothers next to our room who saw fit to run down the halls and scream into the night. Save you money, go to the Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Going to a concert? Stay here”
Reviews.Author: klainep
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of its close proximity to Assembly Hall at U of I because of a concert we were seeing there. We could have walked there ..... if we wanted :) (and saved the $5 parking fee U of I charges. Most of the hotel parking is across the street, but that wasn't a big deal. The street wasn't busy and an entrance was close by. The room was really roomy, bathroom a little on the small side. Beds SUPER comfy -- loved that the decor had been updated. The continental breakfast was AWESOME!! Made to order omelets? Yummy!! Check in desk staff very friendly. And TGIF was right next door. That was real convenient as we didn't have a lot of time from check in to when we had to be at the concert.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Will Not Be Able To Compete With Newer Competition Nearby”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: My coworker booked us two rooms at the Hawthorne Suites for our two night stay in October. First impression was that this is an older property and the hotel management is making only the most threadbare efforts to bring it up to date. The lobby is spartan and cold. Looks more like an office building than a hotel. The hallways are dark and dank. My "suite" was actually one large room separated by a half-wall. The "kitchen" in my suite was a dorm-fridge and a dorm-microwave. Disappointing. The television was a 27" CRT. No LCD or HD -- but there was a pretty good selection of channels. Blankets and sheets were new and of higher quality, but still not on par with the Hilton products or the newer HI Express properties. Other furnishings in the room appeared dated -- maybe late 70s early 80s. Airport transportation is available but takes time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lauriegale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a Saturday night here while visiting our son at the Univ of IL. We requested a king room and were very happy with the place. The entire site is non-smoking and very clean. Our room had a king size bed and a wall separating the bed from the living area. That area consisted of a queen size pull-out couch with a coffee table, a desk and chair, and a dorm-size fridge, microwave, and sink. The tv was positioned on a chest of drawers and could be watched from both the bed or couch. The breakfast consisted of made to order omelets, waffles, biscuits and gravy, canadian bacon, fresh fruit and more. The woman at the front desk told me that Wyndham had just bought the place and they were in transition. I hope they don't change a thing. We paid $100 a night and that seems to be the going rate these days for anything decent. We were charged a $3 a night fee for the safe but when asked if we had used it (we had not) the fee was quickly removed. It was a short drive to a large mall and U of IL.

Reviews.Title: “beware of false charges!!!!”
Reviews.Author: karensway
Reviews.Content: We actually thought the Hotel was very nice and we enjoyed our stay until we received our credit card bill and we had a charge of $350.00. We only stayed one night. Obviously , there was some kind of mistake, so I called the hotel. When the woman on the phone looked up my account, I just about flipped out. She said we were charged that because we might have been smoking in our non-smoking room. I DO NOT smoke and either does my husband. We had three small children with us. Nobody was smoking. I hate the smell of smoke and that is why I booked a non-smoking room. I tried to explain this to her, and was given the run around that someone must of found some proof that we were smoking. I asked her what the proof was, and she did not know. After speaking to several representatives of the hotel chain, they agreed to take off the charge. This just happened so, I am hoping they WILL take off this charge because , I have never smoked a cigarette in my life, and I don't like being accused and charged a fee for something I did not do. So, if you stay there, when you check out, have a manager inspect your room for cigarette butts!!! And make sure your not accused like I was.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property”
Reviews.Author: herbharm
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. Staff is helpful and the property is well maintained. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Internet connection is fast and easy to connect. Breakfast was exceptional. They offer just about anything one could imagine. We were at Hawthorn for 5 nights so we had a good opportunity to see their operation over a longer time. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: geraldthetitan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as it was the only vacancy left during an Illini home game. The negative reviews were dated, so we figured they must have updated/remodeled. Wrong! At 200 a night, you figure that you won't be greeted by mold and mildew on the bathroom grout. Cheap blankets and bedding. At least it was fairly quiet. I suppose they ratchet up the rates to take advantage of game weekends. Quite a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: thebandteacher
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here because all the motels on the interstate were booked and I hadn't called ahead to make a reservation. The staff was very friendly and helpful at checkin. Breakfast was good. The room was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Very clean. I don't believe you can read any of the reviews before a year or so ago b/c it was very clean and seemed fairly new. The lobby has a very contemporary look & feel. The cleaners are very nice. The cleaners at the buffet are very attentive, prompt, and nice. The buffet changes some things every day. Nice. The room felt a little small and the parking isn't the best b/c of where/how the hotel and connected businesses are set up. The reception hall was tastefully done for the wedding and the food was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in an aging hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hawthorn about two weeks ago but I did not read the reviews on this hotel until today. I found it amusing to see the reviews are all over the place and just want to put in my two cents. The place gave me a mixed feeling on being a great or a filthy hotel. The room was spacious and clean (as much as possible by the staff), but I hesitated to sit on the couch because it looked worn (or not clean). The bed was nice but not in its best possible shape (also shown signs of age). The room has window type air-conditioner, not the typical hidden type you would expect to see in a higher-end hotel. There were two guest elevators. However, one of them had front and back doors and was used as a service elevator. This arrangment may had saved some costs when they built the hotel but it was unsightly for the guests to be able to see the service side of the hotel. This also explained some reviews' complaints on the elevators being filthy. The breakfast was great but the dining area was small. The great thing about this place was the staff. They were friendly, responsive, diligent and courteous. I really can't complain about the people who worked there. Overall, I think this place had shown its age but was being kept in good shape but its diligent staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Coming from a city known for its hotels my adventure into the heartland was a big change. However after having stayed at the hawthorne 5 times in the last six months I believe it is the best in champaign and the staff make it so. I have consistantly found my requests acted on quickly and although the rooms are old they are kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. Stains on everything from the bed, couch, walls, ironing board, carpet, you name it. Even the elevators were soiled on the walls and floors. I do NOT recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel With Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had just come back from a 15 day business trip in Champaign, Ill. I stayed at the Hawthorn Suites right by the University of Illinois. I have to say that it was one of the most pleasant hotel stay's I have recently had and for as much as I travel that is saying a lot. The people at the hotel were not only professional but were very nice. The rooms were very clean and spacious. I was also amazed by the energy of the staff and how clean they kept the hotel. Each morning I was treated to a hot buffet breakfast which was really good! I just wanted to let everyone know that my stay was great and that I would recommend the Hawthorn Suites in Champaign to anyone traveling for any reason. --KRB

Reviews.Title: “suspicious anonymous reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Interesting that the positive review for the Drury and the negative review for the Hawthorn were written on the same day! Does someone have a vested interest here? We enjoyed our stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham Champaign
HotelInfo.Address: 101 Trade Center Drive, Champaign, IL 61820
